intro: Bouteloua tamaulipensis, commonly known as Tamaulipan bluestem, is a grass species native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, blue-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Bouteloua tamaulipensis plays an important role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
